```{r}
library(ggplot2)

# Function to generate beta distribution data
generate_beta_data <- function(alpha, beta) {
  x <- seq(0, 1, by = 0.01)
  y <- dbeta(x, alpha, beta)
  data.frame(x = x, y = y)
}

# Plot beta distribution for different alpha and beta values
plot_beta_distribution <- function(alpha, beta, color) {
  data <- generate_beta_data(alpha, beta)
  ggplot(data, aes(x, y)) +
    geom_line(color = color, size = 1) +
    labs(title = sprintf("Beta Distribution (alpha = %g, beta = %g)", alpha, beta),
         x = "Probability", y = "Density") +
    theme_minimal()
}

# Set alpha and beta values
alpha_values <- c(0.2, 0.5, 0.7, 1)
beta_values <- alpha_values

# Create subplots for each combination of alpha and beta
par(mfrow = c(2, 2))
for (i in 1:length(alpha_values)) {
  plot_beta_distribution(alpha_values[i], beta_values[i], rainbow(length(alpha_values))[i])
}
```
